description: From translingual Baci(llus subtilis) +‎ Tracy +‎ -in. Named after American child Margaret Treacy (1936–1994), in whose leg infection the compound was first found.

entries.meaning: (pharmacology) A nonprescription polypeptide antibiotic isolated from a bacillus (Bacillus subtilis or Bacillus licheniformis), usually provided in topical ointment form especially against gram-positive bacteria.
